meanings.definition: To exceed in weight, value, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The elephant's size and strength outbalance the rabbit's.
meanings.sent2: In a tug-of-war, the heavier team can easily outbalance the lighter one.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant tried to outbalance the massive elephant in a game of chess.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness always seemed to outbalance any negative emotions in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun seemed to outbalance the dark clouds, bringing warmth and light to the day.

meanings.definition: To be more significant or influential than something else.
meanings.sent1: His hard work and dedication outbalance his lack of experience.
meanings.sent2: The impact of her words can easily outbalance any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent3: The little seed hoped to outbalance the big tree by growing faster.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song seemed to outbalance the simple lyrics, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: Her determination to succeed always seemed to outbalance any obstacles in her way.
